description: From Latin ambiguus (“moving from side to side, of doubtful nature”), from ambigere (“to go about, wander, doubt”), from ambi- (“around, about, on both sides”) + agere (“to drive, move”).

adjectives.description: ambiguous (comparative more ambiguous, superlative most ambiguous)

examples: The politician was criticized for his ambiguous statements and lack of precision.

entries.meaning: (obsolete, of persons) Hesitant; uncertain; not taking sides.
examples: And forasmuch as in this same question I am ambiguous, and Simplicius is resolute....
